page.title: 06THE NEW AIRDRIE RING ROAD.
page.content: WORK ON THE NEW AIRDRIE RING ROAD BEGAN ON THE 18 MARCH 1985 AND WILL FINISH,HOPEFULLY,IN APRIL 1986.THE REASON FOR IT BEING BUILT IS TO RELIEVE THE TRAFFIC CONGESTION AND IMPROVE THE TRAFFIC FLOW. IT WILL COST THE RATEPAYERS ABOUT Â£900,000.FROM GARTLEA ROAD TO BUCHANNAN STREET WILL BE A PEDESTRIAN PLAZA.CRAIG STREET WILL BE CLOSED OFF AND SOUTHBRIDGE STREET MAY REVERT TO TWO WAY TRAFFIC.THE TRAFFIC LIGHTS NEW AIRDRIE CROSS WILL NOT BE AFFECTED.THREE ROUND-A-BOUTS WILL BE BUILT USING RED AND WHITE BRICK.THESE ARE THE COLOURS OF AIRDRIEONIANS FOOTBALL CLUB.ONE OF THESE ROUND-A-BOUTS WILL BE OUTSIDE OF OUR SCHOOL-ALEXANDRA PRIMARY AT THE BOTTOM OF BROOMKNOLL STREET.THERE WILL BE A FOOTPATH AND PELICAN CROSSING FOR PEOPLE.NO BUILDING TO BE DEMOLISHED.
